subject: Programming
title: Dynamic Programming
description: A quick, practical guide to Dynamic Programming.

hook.text: Some problems solve the same subproblem hundreds of times. That's wasted work.

buildup.text: Dynamic programming stores subproblem results so they're computed once and reused.

discovery.text: The Fibonacci sequence without caching takes billions of steps. With caching, it takes dozens.

twist.text: Recognizing overlapping subproblems is the hard part. Not every problem has them.

climax.text: GPS routing, spell checkers, and DNA sequencing all rely on dynamic programming.

punchline.text: Remember the answer. Never solve it twice.

quiz.question: What is the core idea behind dynamic programming?
